Notes
ALL meetings are scheduled on Eastern Standard Time.
Persons wishing rooms near the University may write to Lowell
Wrigley, Director of Men’s Housing, Administration Building, Ohio
State University.
An audition room is provided for the members of the Institute at
the offices of the Radio Division of the Bureau of Educational Research
in Hayes Hall Annex, just south of the Social Administration Building.
All recordings entered in the Second American Exhibition will be avail¬
able for auditing. Programs to be heard will be scheduled as requested.
A complete list of the recordings and reservation blanks may be obtained
at the registration desk.
Open discussion on matters of radio education is one of the chief
functions of the Institute. Each address will be followed by discussion
in which all members are urged to take part.
Each year the proceedings of the Institute are published under the
tide, Education on the Air. The yearbooks may be purchased at $3 a
copy from Ohio State University, except the 1935 yearbook which may
be purchased from the University of Chicago Press. A reduced price for
back copies of the yearbook is made when purchased in sets.
Tickets for the dinner Tuesday evening, May 3, may be purchased
at the registration desk; the price is $1.50. All reservations for the
dinner must be made by Monday noon, May 2.
Registration facilities and a bureau of information will be main¬
tained in the main hallway of the Social Administration Building. At
